intro: Cryptolepis welwitschii var. luteola, commonly known as the yellow cryptolepis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and branched stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has small, opposite leaves. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies. The yellow coloration of its flowers is due to the presence of specific flavonoids and other pigments.
